oai_dc:dc.dc:title: John T. Wilder
Gen. John T. Wilder, 17th Indiana Infantry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John T. Wilder was a colonel in the 17th Indiana Infantry who was later promoted to Bvt. Brigadier General. After the war, he founded the Roane Iron Works just outside the city of Chattanooga where he later became mayor. This studio portrait was found in an album labeled volume 113, Mollus [Massachusetts Commandery Military Order of the Loyal Legion] Collection, U. S. Army Military History Institute.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wilder, John Thomas,--1830-1917--Military service; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865.
Building a Future Through Opportunity; Capturing the Flag
